title: Drawing, The Assumption of the Virgin, early 17th century
medium: red crayon, pen and ink, brush and gray wash, and sepia on paper
markings: On the back the rubber stamp: "MB"(?) inside a square.
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee, Boston; 1938: acquired by Museum
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle. Upon Clouds. In the center is the Virgin, in a glory of rays. At left is an angel playing the lute. At right another one playing the organ; both with groups of angels. Cherubim below. Compare with drawing by [sp?] reproduced in Röhrer "Sammlung H.S Röhrer," Augsburg, 1928, pl. 103. Salimbeni attribution considered wrong by Philip Pouncy (verbally, March, 1958).

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, The Assumption of the Virgin, early 17th century. red crayon, pen and ink, brush and gray wash, and sepia on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-7701.
